author: latercera.com
title: Fuertes vientos y lluvia sobre Santiago por sistema frontal - La Tercera
text:
Claudio Portilla Hace 2 horas Tiempo de lectura: 4 minutos Fuertes vientos se esperan a ra√≠z del sistema frontal para la Regi√≥n Metropolitana. Foto: Javier Salvo/Aton Chile Aproximadamente 500 sem√°foros se encuentran apagados en la Regi√≥n Metropolitana a ra√≠z de cortes de energ√≠a o da√±os producidos por el sistema frontal.
compartir Comentarios Un nuevo sistema frontal afecta a la Regi√≥n Metropolitana y zona centro sur del pa√≠s, dejando calles anegadas, viviendas da√±adas y a miles de clientes sin suministro el√©ctrico en la regi√≥n.
Para Santiago se prev√© que caigan entre 30 y 50 mil√≠metros y hasta 60 mm en el sector oriente y en la precordillera de la Costa. Por otro lado, en Valpara√≠so se pronostican vientos de hasta 70 km/hr hasta el mediod√≠a del viernes.
El Servicio Nacional de Prevenci√≥n y Respuesta ante Desastres (Senapred) decret√≥ Alerta Amarilla para la Regi√≥n Metropolitana a ra√≠z de la emergencia.
Sigue en La Tercera todos los detalles del avance del sistema frontal :
8.45
Desde Transporte Informa alertaron sobre la ca√≠da de varios √°rboles y postes de cables entre Punta Arenas y Estadio, en la comuna de San Joaqu√≠n.
8.35
El Aeropuerto de Santiago inform√≥ que se encuentra operativo, tras una interrupci√≥n preventiva por las condiciones clim√°ticas. Asimismo, se hizo un llamado a los pasajeros a revisar el estado de sus vuelos.
7:53
Transporte Informa de la Regi√≥n Metropolitana informa de la ca√≠da de varios √°rboles en camino Melipilla en direcci√≥n a Santiago. La situaci√≥n ha obligado a interrumpir el tr√°nsito generando una gran congesti√≥n en el lugar.
7:47
De acuerdo a la estaciones de Meteorolog√≠a de Chile, se registraron rachas de viento de ha0sta 124 kil√≥metros por hora en la comuna de Pudahuel y de hasta 112 km/h en Colina.
7:30
Ministerio de Educaci√≥n detalla las comunas afectadas por la suspensi√≥n de clases a nivel nacional:
Suspensi√≥n total:
Regiones de Coquimbo, Metropolitana, Biob√≠o y La Araucan√≠a Suspensi√≥n parcial:
Regi√≥n de Valpara√≠so: Suspensi√≥n de clases preventiva en establecimientos municipales de las comunas de Algarrobo, Cabildo, Cartagena, El Quisco, El Tabo, Hijuelas, La Calera, La Cruz, La Ligua, Limache, Olmu√©, Papudo, Petorca, San Antonio, Santo Domingo y Zapallar,. Regi√≥n de O‚ÄôHiggins: Suspensi√≥n de clases de establecimientos municipales de las comunas de Navidad, Paredones, Pichilemu, San Vicente, Las Cabras, Pichidegua, Peumo, Requinoa, Malloa, Do√±ihue, Rancagua, Quinta de Tilcoco, Olivar y Codegua. Regi√≥n del Maule: Suspensi√≥n de clases en los establecimientos municipales en las comunas de Pelluhue, Curepto, Huala√±√©, Sagrada Familia, Rauco y Teno. Se suman las escuelas de sectores rurales de Pencahue; los establecimientos municipales y jardines de Junji e Integra de la comuna de Constituci√≥n y los establecimientos municipales y jardines de Fundaci√≥n Integra en Chanco. Regi√≥n de √ëuble: Suspensi√≥n en los establecimientos municipales de las comunas de San Nicol√°s, Cobquecura, El Carmen, Ranquil, San Ignacio, Yungay, Quill√≥n, Ninhue, Bulnes y El Carmen. Adem√°s, en 3 establecimientos educacionales de las comunas de Quill√≥n, Chill√°n y Coelemu por da√±o de infraestructura. Regi√≥n de Los R√≠os: Suspensi√≥n de clases en las comunas de R√≠o Bueno, Futrono, La Uni√≥n, Lago Ranco, Los Lagos, Mariquina, Mafil, Lanco, Panguipulli y Paillaco. Regi√≥n de Los Lagos: Suspensi√≥n de clases en los establecimientos municipales de las comunas de San Pablo, San Juan de la Costa, R√≠o Negro, Puerto Octay, Purranque, Castro, Puyehue, Queil√©n y Calbuco. Adem√°s, cierran los establecimientos del SLEP Llanquihue, conformado por las comunas de Frutillar, Llanquihue, Puerto Varas, Fresia y Los Muermos. Se suman a la suspensi√≥n los establecimientos particulares subvencionados Colegio Wanelenwe de la comuna de Castro, el Centro Educacional San Pedro de Quell√≥n y el Colegio Llacolen de Quell√≥n; San Benito, rosario de las animas, La Pradera, El Roble y Santa Cruz de la comuna de San Pablo. 7:24
La historia continua m√°s abajo
M√°s sobre Sistema Frontal Delegado de la RM afirma que la cantidad de clientes sin luz por el sistema frontal es la mayor ‚Äúen much√≠simos a√±os‚Äù hace 13 minutos 12 regiones con alertas meteorol√≥gicas por lluvias, vientos y probables tormentas el√©ctricas hace 18 minutos Seg√∫n dio a conocer el Delegado Presidencial de la Regi√≥n Metropolitana, Gonzalo Dur√°n, ‚Äúen el marco del frente de mal tiempo que enfrenta la Regi√≥n Metropolitana y otras regiones del pa√≠s, hemos constituido en horas de la madrugada el Cogrid con el prop√≥sito de monitorear los alcances de este frente en toda la regi√≥n. La principal afectaci√≥n es que en el marco de fuertes vientos de hasta 124 kil√≥metros por hora en algunas zonas de la regi√≥n, se ha afectado de manera importante el suministro de energ√≠a el√©ctrica. Tenemos ca√≠da de postes, √°rboles sobre el tendido el√©ctrico y otras afectaciones‚Äù.
Por otro lado, de acuerdo a lo que detallaron las autoridades, ‚ÄúEs importante decir que el sistema frontal va a ir en decaimiento durante el d√≠a y hasta ma√±ana s√°bado, inclusive, las precipitaciones van a ser de bastante menor intensidad y el componente viento tambi√©n va a ir decreciendo, por lo tanto, de a poco, paulatinamente, la regi√≥n va a ir retomando su normalidad. Es importante indicar que, y lo va seguramente a decir la Subintendencia de Electricidad y Combustible, la electricidad no va a llegar inmediatamente a las viviendas, primero, por la cantidad de puntos cr√≠ticos que hay en la regi√≥n y porque la cantidad de cuadrillas tambi√©n son finitas, por lo tanto, tienen que ir paso a paso levantando cada una de las √°reas que est√°n afectadas. El llamado a la comunidad es hacer caso a lo que diga la autoridad, eso es importante‚Äù.
7:15
De acuerdo a lo que reporta Transporte Informa de la Regi√≥n de Valpara√≠so, se registran cortes de luz, v√≠as inundadas y escombros en camino en diferentes puntos de la regi√≥n.
7:12
De acuerdo a lo que informa la Superintendencia de Electricidad y Combustibles (SEC), actualmente se encuentran 1.1 millones de clientes sin suministro el√©ctrico a nivel nacional.
De estos 631 mil pertenecen a la Regi√≥n Metropolitana, 119 mil a la Regi√≥n de O‚Äôhiggins y 109 mil a la Regi√≥n de La Araucan√≠a.
7:05
Metro de Santiago informa que la estaci√≥n Santa Julia en la L√≠nea 4a se encuentra sin servicio. El resto de la red est√° disponible.
6:57
Informan que la Alameda al oriente se encuentra totalmente bloqueada a la altura de Almirante Latorre por la ca√≠da de un √°rbol en la v√≠a.
6:53
De acuerdo a lo que inform√≥ la Ministra del Interior, Carolina Toh√°, habr√° una reuni√≥n del Comit√© para la Gesti√≥n del Riesgo de Desastres (Cogrid) a las 7:30 horas. ‚ÄúDebido a los fuertes vientos en varias regiones del pa√≠s, recomendamos a todas las personas que eviten salir a la calle y, si debe hacerlo, tengan extrema cautela‚Äù, se√±al√≥ a trav√©s de X.
6.44
Aproximadamente 500 sem√°foros se encuentran apagados en la Regi√≥n Metropolitana a ra√≠z de cortes de energ√≠a o da√±os producidos por el sistema frontal que afecta a la regi√≥n.
6.40
Suspenden las clases en toda la Regi√≥n Metropolitana a ra√≠z del sistema frontal. De acuerdo a lo que explicaron desde el ministerio ‚ÄúEste viernes 2 de agosto se suspender√°n las clases en todos los establecimientos de la Regi√≥n Metropolitana: Jardines Junji, Integra, VTF, adem√°s de todos los establecimientos educacionales p√∫blicos, particulares subvencionados y particulares pagados‚Äù.
Mineduc suspende las clases en toda la Regi√≥n Metropolitana por sistema frontal Comenta Los comentarios en esta secci√≥n son exclusivos para suscriptores. Suscr√≠bete aqu√≠.
De cu√°nto fue el sismo de este viernes 2 de agosto en Chile Baltasar Daza Hace 2 horas 12 regiones con alertas meteorol√≥gicas por lluvias, vientos y probables tormentas el√©ctricas Sandar Estrella Oporto hace 18 minutos ¬øCu√°ntos feriados hay en agosto? Sandar Estrella Oporto Hace 21 horas Imperdibles C√≥mo se prepararon Mar√≠a Corina Machado y la oposici√≥n venezolana para desmentir la victoria de Maduro La Tercera ‚ÄúLe da verg√ºenza‚Äù: La medida solicitada por la defensa de la diputada Orsini que es cuestionada por Daniela Ar√°nguiz La Cuarta La particular reacci√≥n de Jordhy Thompson por ola de cr√≠tica tras volver con ex pareja que lo denunci√≥ por violencia La Cuarta Qu√© es ‚Äúel escote de la muerte‚Äù, el fen√≥meno que afectar√° a Chile los pr√≥ximos d√≠as La Tercera La historia de la profesora que abus√≥ de un estudiante de 12 a√±os y se cas√≥ con √©l lleg√≥ a Netflix La Tercera Ver docuserie: Todo por la tele, 25 a√±os de la far√°ndula La Tercera

author: Andrew Boardwine
title: Crowds Vanish from Magic Kingdom, Theme Park Becomes "Ghost Town"
text:
Right now, Magic Kingdom‚Äôs crowd levels are shockingly low. At the busiest time of the day, no ride in the park has a wait time exceeding 60 minutes, with some major attractions practically walk-ons.
Credit: Disney Space Mountain is only a 20-minute wait, Haunted Mansion sits at 20 minutes, Pirates of the Caribbean is at 10 minutes, and even meeting Mickey Mouse at Town Square Theater takes just 15 minutes. It‚Äôs a rare sight, especially for one of the most visited theme parks in the world. For Disney enthusiasts, this might feel like stepping into an alternate reality where long lines and jam-packed walkways don‚Äôt exist.
But low crowds don‚Äôt mean Magic Kingdom has lost its charm. There‚Äôs a reason it remains Disney World‚Äôs most beloved park. For many, stepping onto Main Street, U.S.A., and seeing Cinderella Castle feels like entering a storybook.
The combination of the park‚Äôs immersive theming, nostalgic attractions, and family-friendly rides makes it a must-visit for anyone traveling to Disney World. Families come here for the mix of nostalgia and adventure, from classic dark rides like Peter Pan‚Äôs Flight to thrilling attractions like TRON Lightcycle / Run . Magic Kingdom is also the only park in Disney World with multiple themed lands, offering everything from pirate adventures to futuristic space travel.
Credit: Disney It‚Äôs designed to make every guest, no matter their age, feel like a kid again. Plus, with its iconic entertainment offerings, including parades, fireworks, and character meet-and-greets, the park offers an all-encompassing Disney experience that‚Äôs hard to beat.
Beyond the attractions, Magic Kingdom‚Äôs history and atmosphere play a big role in its continued popularity. Opened in 1971, it was designed as a place where families could step into a world of fantasy and adventure.
Generations of guests have built cherished memories here, from their first ride on Dumbo the Flying Elephant to their first bite of a Mickey-shaped ice cream bar. The park also provides seasonal overlays and limited-time events, such as Mickey‚Äôs Not-So-Scary Halloween Party and Mickey‚Äôs Very Merry Christmas Party, drawing in visitors who want to experience the park in a whole new light.
So why are crowds so low? A major reason is Magic Kingdom‚Äôs early closure today. The park is shutting down at 4:30 p.m. for a private cast member event, which has likely deterred guests who want a full day at the parks. Many visitors may have opted for EPCOT or Hollywood Studios instead, where they can enjoy attractions well into the night.
Credit: Haydn Blackey, Flickr Additionally, this time of year is already a slower season, falling between the holiday rush and the upcoming spring break crowds. Many guests looking for a winter getaway visit in early January or opt to wait for school breaks in February and March, leaving late January as one of the best times to visit for those seeking lower crowd levels. Weather can also play a role, as cooler temperatures and occasional rain showers may dissuade some guests from heading to the parks.
For those visiting today, this is an incredible opportunity. Days like this, where you can ride Space Mountain with almost no wait, are few and far between.
It‚Äôs the perfect time to experience Magic Kingdom‚Äôs magic without the usual crowds and long lines. Guests can truly take their time enjoying everything the park has to offer, from taking leisurely strolls down Main Street, U.S.A., to hopping between rides with minimal delays. With fewer people around, dining reservations become easier to snag, and you can explore the park at your own pace without feeling rushed. There‚Äôs also more time to soak in the details of each land, whether it‚Äôs spotting hidden Mickeys or interacting with cast members who bring the magic to life.
Credit: Marada, Flickr But if you‚Äôre hoping for this trend to last, don‚Äôt count on it‚Äîonce the park returns to normal hours, expect the crowds to come roaring back. Magic Kingdom remains the most popular park in Walt Disney World, and while crowd dips like this are a rare treat, they don‚Äôt last forever. If anything, today‚Äôs lull serves as a reminder that sometimes, the best Disney experiences come when you least expect them. If you ever have the chance to visit during one of these rare low-crowd days, take advantage of it‚Äîyou may never see the park this empty again!

author: kadn.com
title: Jennings mother pleads no contest to negligent homicide in hot car death of 10-month-old daughter - NewsBreak
text:
kadn.com
website
Jennings
Jennings mother pleads no contest to negligent homicide in hot car death of 10-month-old daughter
1 days ago
A Jennings mother charged with murder after her 10-month-old daughter died in a hot car entered a plea to a lesser charge. District Attorney Lauren Heinen said Hannah Cormier, 33, of Jennings, pleaded no contest to negligent homicide. Under Louisiana law, the maximum sentence for negligent homicide is 10 years, up to a $5,000 fine, or both. However, because the victim is under 10 years old, the law mandates enhanced penalties, meaning Cormier must serve at least two years of her sentence at hard labor without the benefit of parole, probation, or suspension of sentence. Judge Steve Gunnell has set a sentencing date of January 21, 2026.

author: Anonym
title: Accusation of ‚Äúblasphemy‚Äù: Indian justice system orders zoo lions to be renamed - Teller Report
text: Enlarge image A zoo in India is facing blasphemy accusations over the names of two lions Photo: Diptendu Dutta / ZUMA Wire / IMAGO Two zoo lions named after a Hindu goddess and a Muslim ruler are keeping the judiciary busy in India. The relevant court ordered the authorities in the state of West Bengal to rename the lions after a Hindu organization requested that the two animals be banned from being kept together in an enclosure. The lioness Sita and the lion Akbar came to the zoo in the city of Siliguri through an exchange program from a neighboring country of India. In Hinduism, Sita is the wife of Ram, who is one of the most important gods and the hero of the Indian national epic ‚ÄúRamayana‚Äù. Akbar ruled almost the entire Indian subcontinent as emperor of the Mughal Empire in the 16th century. The Hindu nationalist organization Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP), which, among other things, fights against marriages between Hindus and Muslims, also went to court against the lion couple living together in the Siliguri Zoo. She spoke of an act of ‚Äúblasphemy‚Äù with which the zoo hurt the religious feelings of Hindus. Justice Saugata Bhattacharyya of the Kolkata High Court has now asked the authorities to rename the lions. "These names should be avoided and dropped to avoid unnecessary controversy," he said, according to the Hindustan Times newspaper. Government advisor Joyjit Choudhury said that the state of West Bengal had already ‚Äúthought about‚Äù giving the lions new names. Critics accuse Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of wanting to transform constitutionally secular India into a Hindu nationalist state and marginalize the huge Muslim minority. Since he took office in 2014, intolerance towards India's 200 million Muslims has increased. svs/AFP

organizations.name: dutta / zuma wire / imago two zoo lions

author: Philip Giraldi
title: Biden‚Äôs America Surrenders to War Criminal Netanyahu, by Philip Giraldi - The Unz Review
text: I don‚Äôt have anyone whom I would consider a friend who supports the genocide being carried out by Israel in Gaza. But my occasional interaction with the psychopaths who infest the US government and media and who are intimately connected by virtue of their political instincts as well as their personal interests in campaign donations and/or elevated salaries derived from Israel and its powerful lobby have plenty of sound bites to throw out to demonstrate their love of the Jewish state in all its manifestations. They mouth the Pelosi-Schumer-Biden assertion that ‚ÄúIsrael has a right to defend itself‚Äù and that Israel is ‚ÄúAmerica‚Äôs closest ally‚Äù and ‚Äúbest friend,‚Äù all of which can readily be exposed as a series of self-serving lies and deliberate misinterpretations of international law. Beyond that, they inevitably cite their view that critics of Israel are fully responsible for what they choose to refer to as the ultimate evil of ‚Äúsurging anti-semitism.‚Äù In so doing they conveniently ignore the obvious fact that anger towards Jews collectively speaking is nearly always derived from the crimes against humanity committed by the Zionist political entity that now legally defines itself as Jewish. I sometimes ask the friends of Israel what interest the United States has that would warrant our country becoming complicit in committing war crimes that, collectively speaking, amount to precursors for the complete expulsion or killing of millions of Palestinians from what remains of their homes. They try to weasel word their way avoiding the implications of that question by observing that the United States is not directly engaged in the conflict, an evasion that I belittle by pointing out that Washington is providing funding, arming and political cover for the more powerful and lethal party engaged in the conflict while also blocking attempts to bring about a ceasefire to comply with orders from that same party, which sure looks like direct involvement to me. I also point out that Israel is working hard to get the US military engaged against Hezbollah in Lebanon and also against Iran and is likely to be able to maneuver the stoneheads in and around the White House to do its bidding vis-√†-vis both objectives. So the big question has to be ‚ÄúWhy does the United States engage in a conflict that inter alia has utterly ruined our country‚Äôs reputation worldwide and for which there is no real compelling national interest?‚Äù The answer is, of course unpalatable to many, but has to be that the US government is in many respects and vis-√†-vis some of its designated national policies completely under the control of Israel and its powerful domestic as well as international lobby. This habitual bowing to force majeure has warped the thinking of the ambitious scallywags who seem to be present wherever one turns in places like Washington. How else does one explain the infamous and quite frankly ridiculous comment delivered at the 2018 Israeli American Council meeting by [leading politician Nancy Pelosi](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=53x_zrkJwDs), who said that ‚ÄúI have said to people when they ask me if this Capitol crumbled to the ground, the one thing that would remain is our commitment to our aid‚Ä¶and I don‚Äôt even call it aid‚Ä¶our cooperation with Israel. That‚Äôs fundamental to who we are.‚Äù The delusional Pelosi, who appears to have no ‚Äúfundamental‚Äù attachment to the interests of the American people whom she represents, is unfortunately not unique in the halls of Congress, even less so in the Joe Biden White House, which might be regarded as the illustration of what happens when you appoint Zionists to nearly all key positions running your foreign, economic and national security policies. The degree of direct Zionist/Israeli control over the hapless Biden can best be illustrated by reviewing the course of the recent redrafting of a UN Security Council resolution authored by the United Arab Emirates that sought to bring about a suspension of the fighting and the urgent resumption of humanitarian supplies for Gaza. The US forced the revisions after coordination with Israel to permit the Israelis to continue to attack civilian targets and avoid entering into anything like a ceasefire, changing the word ‚Äúsuspension‚Äù in the original draft to the less demanding creation of ‚Äúconditions for a sustainable cessation of hostilities.‚Äù Language authorizing the lead UN role in monitoring and delivering the assistance to the Gazans was also expunged leaving to belligerent Israel the task of completely controlling the distribution of any supplies allowed entry into the areas inside Gaza, which it is also simultaneously continuing to bomb, thereby slowing the stream of urgently needed supplies to a trickle while also killing hundreds more civilians. To be sure, it was the United States blindly supporting Israel that rendered what was a promising proposal to put an end to the multiplying civilian deaths toothless. Israel demonstrated just how high it regarded Joe Biden when it contradicted what the president said about the US being able to moderate some Israeli offensive action in Gaza. Netanyahu denied that, [saying that](https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2023-12-24/israels-netanyahu-says-military-acts-based-on-israeli-calculations) he and his war cabinet were continuing to make all relevant decisions based on Israel‚Äôs own interests. Israel Defense Force (IDF) Chief of the General Staff General Herzi Halevi followed on with [his own assessment](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/israel-is-close-to-dismantling-hamas-in-northern-gaza-but-war-will-last-many-months-chief-warns/ar-AA1m41zY) that finishing the job in Gaza, i.e. totally destroying Hamas by whatever means it requires, will take ‚Äúmany more months.‚Äù The Israeli military has indeed visibly increased its efforts by opening up new ‚Äúbattle zones‚Äù inside Gaza, to include directly targeting the [crowded and starving refugee camps](https://news.yahoo.com/israeli-forces-bombard-central-gaza-101359010.html) outside the cities. The civilians are paying the price while a grinning Joe Biden is spending his New Year‚Äôs holiday in the American Virgin Islands. Allowing Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, a known liar and habitual war criminal to tell the US government what to do is about as low as it gets, Mr. Biden! You should not only be ashamed, but more than that, humiliated, compelled to do ghastly things in support of your own fear of possible Jewish/Israeli reaction if you do not bow down before King Netanyahu. He and the band of inhuman monsters he has assembled in his cabinet have made no secret of their intention to remove the Palestinians from Palestine, either by forced emigration or by killing them if necessary. On Christmas Day, Prime Minister Netanyahu told a meeting of his Likud bloc ‚Äúthat he was still working on the ‚Äòvoluntary‚Äô immigration of Gaza‚Äôs inhabitants to other countries.‚Äù His associates Itamar Ben-Gvir and Bezalel Smotrich have made it clear that the ethnic cleansing process will proceed even if it is not in any way voluntary. As Israel is the occupying power in the former Palestine, what is taking place is, as defined by the Geneva Conventions, the Genocide Convention and the UN Charter, a crime against humanity and the United States is completely complicit in it not to mention actually enabling the slaughter through its supplying of arms and money to the Israelis. It has recently been reported in the Israeli media that the United States has delivered an astonishing ‚Äú10,000 tons of armaments and military equipment on 244 cargo planes and 20 ships‚Äù to sustain the Israeli homicidal [assault against the people of Gaza](https://english.almayadeen.net/news/politics/-israel--receives-244-us-cargo-planes--20-ships-of-military). And to demonstrate its gratitude for the flood of weapons, America‚Äôs ‚Äúbest friend‚Äù and ‚Äúclosest ally‚Äù Israel has nevertheless complained ‚Äúabout a [delay in the delivery of munitions](https://www.axios.com/2023/12/25/netanayahu-dermer-gaza-israel-hamas-war-talks).‚Äù The total support of the Israeli genocide of the Palestinians by Washington and the media is not only shameful, it is lacking any context for a crime against humanity that has been going on with US connivance for the past 76 years. Under international law, an occupied people has a right to use force to resist occupation, but even given that, the majority of Israeli deaths on October 7th should probably be attributed to so-called ‚Äúfriendly fire‚Äù from the Israeli army not from Hamas. The occupied and woefully abused Palestinians rising-up and seeking both freedom and sovereignty in the land that was once completely theirs is fully justified and should be respected. Israel‚Äôs killing women and children through deliberate starvation or even by execution style is indisputably a war crime. Bombing hospitals or leaving newborn incubator [babies abandoned to die](https://www.caitlinjohnst.one/p/israels-savagery-is-so-shocking-its) is a crime against humanity. Arresting innocent Palestinians before parading them naked and even desecrating their dead bodies by [harvesting organs](https://www.newarab.com/news/israel-stealing-organs-dead-bodies-gaza-officials) that you then sell is unspeakable and almost unimaginable evil as is deliberately targeting and bombing schools and churches where people are trying to find shelter. The genocide and destruction in Gaza is the worst crime committed in modern history and the man who could have stopped it, Joe Biden, sits on his hands and grins. No one should remain silent when confronted by this horror but the silence and the deliberate distortion of what is taking place is a tribute to Jewish power in America and elsewhere. I am including [some recent commentary](https://www.caitlinjohnst.one/p/the-us-is-just-as-culpable-as-israel) from the illustrious Australian Journalist Caitlin Johnstone which demonstrates perfectly the hypocrisy and inhumanity of both Biden and the leaders of Britain, France, Canada, and Germany: ‚ÄúSometimes Israel‚Äôs crimes are so horrific that at first you don‚Äôt even understand what you‚Äôre looking at. You just stare at it trying to make sense of what you‚Äôre seeing for a bit, like you would if you suddenly saw a space alien or a leprechaun or something‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs so incredibly obvious what we‚Äôre looking at here. The only thing putting a wobble on people‚Äôs perception is the immense amount of [propaganda distortion](https://www.mintpressnews.com/propaganda-blitz-how-mainstream-media-is-pushing-fake-palestine-stories/285992/) the media is churning out on this issue, plus the fact that the demographics look a bit different from what history has conditioned people to watch out for. If there were two million Jewish people trapped by Christians in a giant concentration camp and placed under total siege, being told that half of them had 24 hours to relocate into the other half or be killed, nobody would have any confusion about what they were witnessing.‚Äù And a leading American journalist Daniel Larison must have the last word of advice from his site on Eunomia: ‚ÄúWe are witnessing one of the gravest crimes of our time. Our government is aiding and abetting the perpetrators. It is up to people in this country to make our government cut off all support for this war and to press for an end to the war itself.‚Äù Amen, Daniel! Philip M. Giraldi, Ph.D., is Executive Director of the Council for the National Interest, a 501(c)3 tax deductible educational foundation (Federal ID Number #52-1739023) that seeks a more interests-based U.S. foreign policy in the Middle East. Website is councilforthenationalinterest.org, address is P.O. Box 2157, Purcellville VA 20134 and its email is [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#c5acaba3aab7a885a6abacaaaba9acaba0ebaab7a2). [Foreign Policy](/category/foreign-policy/)‚Ä¢ Tags: [Benjamin Netanyahu](/topic/benjamin-netanyahu/), [Bezalel Smotrich](/topic/bezalel-smotrich/), [Gaza](/topic/gaza/), [Genocide](/topic/genocide/), [Hamas](/topic/hamas/), [Israel](/topic/israel/), [Israel Lobby](/topic/israel-lobby/), [Israel/Palestine](/topic/israel-palestine/), [Itamar Ben-Gvir](/topic/itamar-ben-gvir/), [Joe Biden](/topic/joe-biden/), [Nancy Pelosi](/topic/nancy-pelosi/), [Palestinians](/topic/palestinians/), [United Nations Security Council](/topic/united-nations-security-council/), [Zionism](/topic/zionism/)

author: R. G.
title: Considerable ascenso de las temperaturas en la provincia de Granada
text:
La Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a (AEMET) estima que durante este fin de semana podr√°n disfrutarse unas temperaturas que se alejan considerablemente de las g√©lidas cifras que rebasaban los 0¬∫ y cubr√≠an de blanco algunas zonas de la provincia de Granada.
El term√≥metro est√° de suerte, pues las temperaturas inician su ascenso desde este viernes hasta el pr√≥ximo domingo, lo cual se percibir√° notablemente en las m√°ximas del interior y del litoral, adem√°s de no dejar de ser relevante en las m√≠nimas del interior provincial.
En cuanto a los cielos, se mantendr√°n con intervalos de nubes medias y altas, aunque no es descartable la aparici√≥n de brumas matinales en el altiplano de la provincia.
La capital provincial presentar√° unas m√≠nimas de 8¬∫, muy alejadas de los -1¬∫ del pasado viernes, que dejar√°n paso a los 22¬∫ que permitir√°n alejarse ligeramente de los chaquetones. En el altiplano tampoco se producir√°n heladas al no alcanzar los 3¬∫ de m√≠nimas y rebasar los 20¬∫ de m√°xima en Baza. El mercurio marcar√° 23¬∫ grados de m√°ximas en Loja, lo que deja al poniente con unas m√≠nimas de 4¬∫. Por su parte Motril sorprende al no alcanzar las m√°ximas de Loja durante el fin de semana, aunque podr√°n disfrutarse 7¬∫ de m√≠nimas y, sobre todo, 21¬∫ de m√°xima en la costa tropical.
La Agencia Estatal vaticina que los vientos de componente oeste se mantendr√°n con m√≠nimas variaciones, aunque predominar√°n los moderados.

author: @https://twitter.com/KSolomonReports
title: Mid-South families enjoying the snow after first winter storm of the year | News | fox13memphis.com
text:
Mid-South families enjoying the snow after first winter storm of the year Kayla Solomon Kayla Solomon FOX13 Memphis Reporter
Author facebook Author twitter Author email Jan 15, 2024 4 hrs ago Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email WATCH: Mid-South families enjoying the snow after first winter storm of the year
Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save MEMPHIS, Tenn. - The snow may still be falling, but it‚Äôs not keeping everyone indoors.
FOX13 crews have seen kids playing in the snow and earlier today, we found out that Memphis Shelby County Schools will be closed for the next two days.
For some kids in the mid-South, a snow day means sledding and snowmen.
For others, like 14-year-old Joy Jerrolds, it means staying inside.
‚ÄúIf you go outside in the snow, it gets in your socks. And who likes wet socks? Wet socks are gross.‚Äù
By Monday morning, school districts across the entire Mid-South began sending out notices to families that schools would remain closed, especially Memphis Shelby County Schools.
Jerrolds says once she found out school would be closed for at least the next two days, she knew exactly what her days off would consist of.
‚ÄúI love sleeping in on snow days. That's my favorite - sleeping in on snow days.‚Äù
Joy‚Äôs mom, Jennifer, said she did all the grocery shopping and prepping before the storm.
‚ÄúExtra chargers are found so that we can have all of our electronics and we pull out all the board games, make sure all the cards are accounted for, all the parts, and we make sure we have snacks, snacks on deck, lists of movies, that sort of thing, things that are going to keep busy.‚Äù
But still, Jerrolds said the power outages are the biggest concern as the week progresses.
‚ÄúThat's my number one concern this week. Batten down for the cold. We can buy all the snacks we want. But if the power goes out, all of our plans are for not.‚Äù
The temperatures will continue to drop tonight heading into overnight so the concern is still slick sidewalks and roadways.
If you are planning to get out the house, make sure you have your coat, gloves, and boots so your feet don‚Äôt get wet or cold.
